Mon, 11 Dec 2023 08:03:30 +0000 Police were armed at the scene as a precaution. Photo / NZME (file photo)
Whakatāne homicide investigation suggests gang-related death, police condemn ‘retaliatory gang-behaviour’ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/whakatane-homicide-investigation-suggests-gang-lated-death-police-condemn-retaliatory-gang-behaviour/Q2ZNJUEZ5NCB7NUUO3HY7NUBG4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/whakatane-homicide-investigation-suggests-gang-lated-death-police-condemn-retaliatory-gang-behaviour/Q2ZNJUEZ5NCB7NUUO3HY7NUBG4/ Police said there was a gang-related disorder incident before the man died. Mon, 11 Dec 2023 08:03:23 +0000 Police want to hear from anyone in the area at the time of the incident.
Killed Kiwi mum Siva Auvae in Brisbane remembered by lifelong friend https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/killed-kiwi-mum-siva-auvae-in-brisbane-remembered-by-lifelong-friend/XQP5VTYERJHO7B4SD6I7PWIKKQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/killed-kiwi-mum-siva-auvae-in-brisbane-remembered-by-lifelong-friend/XQP5VTYERJHO7B4SD6I7PWIKKQ/ Doug Laing, Benjamin PlummerShe would have celebrated her 32nd birthday on Christmas Day. Mon, 11 Dec 2023 07:24:15 +0000 Siva Auvae, 31, was stabbed to death in Kallangur, Brisbane on December 9.

Sir Collin Tukuitonga resigns from NZ government roles, citing ‘no confidence’ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/sir-collin-tukuitonga-resigns-from-nz-government-roles-citing-no-confidence/SNOMD4MPOBHK5NLU26SUACOVV4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/sir-collin-tukuitonga-resigns-from-nz-government-roles-citing-no-confidence/SNOMD4MPOBHK5NLU26SUACOVV4/ Tukuitonga says he has resigned as the chairman of Te Whatu Ora Pacific Senate. Mon, 11 Dec 2023 06:08:47 +0000 Sir Collin Tukuitonga says he has 'no confidence' in the new Government.
Coromandel man Joey Richards avoids life in jail for fatally stabbing brother after mum’s tangi https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/coromandel-man-joey-richards-avoids-life-in-jail-for-fatally-stabbing-brother-at-mums-tangi/KRAO6GG3BBGTVGJQJEEJHCF7QA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/coromandel-man-joey-richards-avoids-life-in-jail-for-fatally-stabbing-brother-at-mums-tangi/KRAO6GG3BBGTVGJQJEEJHCF7QA/ Belinda FeekJoey Richards must serve a minimum of seven years in jail of a 12-year sentence. Gloriavale sex offences: Greymouth District Court finds 58-year-old man guilty on 11 charges https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/gloriavale-sex-offences-greymouth-district-court-finds-58-year-old-man-guilty-on-11-charges/2XPST2YYFNBR7KR3ACT4AFN5EI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/gloriavale-sex-offences-greymouth-district-court-finds-58-year-old-man-guilty-on-11-charges/2XPST2YYFNBR7KR3ACT4AFN5EI/ Raphael FranksSome of the sex charges date back to the 1980s. Guilty man will be sentenced in March. Mon, 11 Dec 2023 05:58:50 +0000 The Gloriavale Christian Community. Photo / George Heard
Tauranga CPR theft: Man who stole bank cards after crash admits charges in court https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/tauranga-cpr-theft-man-who-stole-bank-cards-after-crash-admits-charges-in-court/ V7NQD35LONHJBPJOGWC7RK47DA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/tauranga-cpr-theft-man-who-stole-bank-cards-after-crash-admits-charges-in-court/ V7NQD35LONHJBPJOGWC7RK47DA/ Sandra ConchieThe defendant has appeared in the Tauranga District Court on dishonesty charges. Mon, 11 Dec 2023 05:40:04 +0000 A man, whose identity is suppressed, pleaded guilty in the Tauranga District Court to charges of stealing bank cards and spending $1037.94. Photo / NZME
Tauranga’s Ngāi Te Rangi files Waitangi Tribunal claim against Government https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/taurangas-ngai-te-rangi-files-waitangi-tribunal-claim-against-government/KQMAGNKLNVEEZMVPTFEEPJR6FI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/taurangas-ngai-te-rangi-files-waitangi-tribunal-claim-against-government/KQMAGNKLNVEEZMVPTFEEPJR6FI/ Megan Wilson'A dismissal of the reo is essentially a dismissal of the whole idea of Māori itself.' Mon, 11 Dec 2023 05:28:58 +0000 Ngāi Te Rangi chairman Charles Tawhiao has filed a complaint on behalf of the Ngāi Te Rangi Settlement Trust against the new Government alleging breaches of the Treaty of Waitangi. Photo / Alex Cairns
